problems.author: Thenura Wickramaratna
problems.question: Which of the following is a derived unit?
problems.hint: It's the SI unit of force.
problems.detailed: A Newton is a derived unit defined as \( \text{kg} \cdot \text{m/s}^2 \), while kilogram, second, and ampere are fundamental SI units.

problems.author: Thenura Wickramaratna
problems.question: Which quantity has the SI unit of \( \text{kg} \cdot \text{m}^2/\text{s}^2 \)?
problems.detailed: Energy has the unit of joules, which is equivalent to \( \text{kg} \cdot \text{m}^2/\text{s}^2 \).

problems.author: Thenura Wickramaratna
problems.question: What is the SI base unit of electric current?
problems.hint: It's one of the seven fundamental SI units.
problems.detailed: The ampere (A) is the SI base unit for electric current.

problems.author: Thenura Wickramaratna
problems.question: Given the equation \( F = ma \), what is the SI unit of force?
problems.hint: Multiply the unit of mass with that of acceleration.
problems.detailed: Force is mass (kg) times acceleration (m/s²), giving \( \text{kg} \cdot \text{m/s}^2 \), which is a Newton (N).

problems.author: Thenura Wickramaratna
problems.question: In the equation for pressure \( P = F/A \), what is the unit of pressure?
problems.detailed: Force is \( \text{kg} \cdot \text{m/s}^2 \), area is \( 	ext{m}^2 \), so pressure is \( 	ext{kg/m·s}^2 \), known as a pascal (Pa).

problems.author: Thenura Wickramaratna
problems.question: Given the equation \( T = 2\pi \sqrt{L/g} \), what is the unit of \( g \)?
problems.hint: Make the RHS dimensionless under the square root.
problems.detailed: For the square root to be unitless, \( L/g \) must be in \( 	ext{s}^2 \), so \( g \) must be in \( 	ext{m/s}^2 \).

problems.author: Thenura Wickramaratna
problems.question: An equation for power is given as \( P = k \cdot A^3 \cdot T \), where \( P \) has units of watts, \( A \) is area in \( 	ext{m}^2 \), and \( T \) is time in seconds. What is the unit of \( k \)?
problems.detailed: Power (P) = \( \text{kg} \cdot \text{m}^2/\text{s}^3 \), A³ = \( \text{m}^6 \), T = s. Solving for \( k \), \( k = P/(A^3 T) = \text{kg} \cdot \text{s}^{-3} \cdot 	ext{m}^{-6} \).
